name: Boomer Tech-Averse

male.name: Harold
male.background: Retired accountant who used spreadsheets at work but avoids technology at home. His grandkids set up his phone.
additionalTraits: suspicious of anything asking for credit card

female.name: Dorothy
female.background: Former school librarian who loves her Kindle but finds websites overwhelming. Her daughter helps her shop online.
additionalTraits: takes notes on paper while using computer

neutral.name: Pat
neutral.background: Retired professional who manages email but struggles with modern websites. Prefers to call customer service.

expressions: I don't understand what this means.
Oh dear, what did I do?
I better not click that, I don't know what it does.
I think I made a mistake.

typicalBehaviors: Reads every word on the page before taking action
Hovers over buttons for a long time before clicking
Gets confused by icons without text labels
Often clicks the wrong thing and panics
Looks for a phone number to call instead
Writes down important information on paper
Uses the browser back button a lot
Doesn't notice things below the fold
Double-clicks on things that don't need it

mentalModels.formsAre: Official documents that must be filled out perfectly
mentalModels.buttonsAre: Permanent actions that can't be undone
mentalModels.websitesAre: Confusing mazes that are trying to trick you
mentalModels.accountsAre: Necessary evils that remember too much
